messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

Egger, Frida.Das Civilstandsamt ist offen : an Werktagen morgens von 8—12 Uhr, nachmittags von 2—4 Uhr in allen Jahreszeiten; an Sonn- und Festtagen von 10— IV1 2 Uhr vormittags.Eheverkündigungs-Begehren werden nur an Werktagen entgegengenommen. Trauungen können an allen Werktagen zu einer beliebigen — wenn wenigstens 2—3 Tage zum voraus mit dem Civil- standsbeamten vereinbarten — Zeit, in den Stunden zwischen 8 Uhr vor- und 4 Uhr nachmittags stattfinden.Bei einer den säumigen Anzeigepflichtigen bedrohenden Geldbusse bis auf Fr. 100 muss jeder innerhalb des Civilstandskreises Bern (Stadt u. Stadtbezirk) sich ereignende Geburtsfall binnen einer Frist von 3 mal 24 Stunden, und jeder Todesfall binnen 48 Stunden auf dem Civilstandsamte angezeigt werden.Die bei diesen Anzeigen erforderlichen Ausweisschriften sind:a) In beiden Fällen : Aufenthalts- Bewilligung oder Niederlassungs- Büchlein, und ferner:b) Bei Geburtsanzeigen : Der Eheschein.c) Bei Todesfällen : 1. das ärztliche Zeugnis; 2. der Geburts- oder Taufschein, sowie die Polizeiausweisschriften.NB. last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

Natur- oder plastisches Zeichnen. 2. Stillehre. 3. Wandtafelübungen. 4. Technisches Zeichnen. 5. Skizzierübungen.Allgemeine Bemerkungen.1. Zur Aufnahme in die erste Abteiteilung (Gewerbliche Fortbildungsschule) ist die absolvierte Schulzeit erforderlich. Das obligatorische Schulzeugnis ist vorzuweisen.Privat-Lehranstalten.64Privat-Lehranstalten.2. Für die zweite Abteilung (Fachkurse für Handwerker) wird Absolvierung der ersten Abteilung mit guten Zeugnissen in den Zeichnungsfächern oder gleichwertige Ausweise verlangt.3. In die dritte Abteilung (Kunstgewerb- licheAbteilung mit Kunstklasse) treten diejenigen ein, welche in kunstgewerblicher Richtung bereits thätig sind oder sich einem kunstgewerblichen Berufe widmen wollen. Für den Unterricht der Dilettant en besteht eine Kunstklasse.4. In der vierten Abteilung (Specialab- teilung für Zeichenlehrer und Lehramtskandidaten) erhalten die Lehramtskandidaten der Hochschule und patent. Primarlehrer die im Reglement vorgeschrieb. AusbildungimZeichnen.5. In die bernische Handwerker- und Kunstgewerbeschule werden auch Töchter aufgenommen.6. Das Schulgeld pro Wintersemester beträgt für alle Kurse in der ersten und zweiten Abteilung der Schule Fr. 6. — und in der dritten Fr. 10. —, vorausbezahlbar. Schüler der I. und II. Abteilung, welche auch Abendkurse der III. besuchen, zahlen Franken 10. —. Der Unterricht in der vierten Abteilung ist unentgeltlich. In der Kunstklasse ist ein Kursgeld von Fr. 20. — zu bezahlen.7. Anmeldungenwerden entgegengenommen im Bureau des Gewerbemuseums, an Werktagen von 8-12, 2—6 und 7'/ 2 - 11 abends, an Sonntagen von 10 bis 12. Anmeldungen in die Kunstklasse sind an Herrn Inspektor Da- vinet, Kunstmuseum, zu richten.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

Für gründliche Erlernung des Berufes ist es unerlässlich und die Rücksicht auf das Bestehen der Lehrlingsprüfung macht es durchaus notwendig, dass die Lehrmeister ihre Lehrlinge schon im ersten Jahre der Lehrzeit zum Besuch der Schule verpflichten.9. Die Lehrmeister werden dringend gebeten, den Besuch der Tageskurse zu ermöglichen.10. Der regelmässige und genügende Besuch der Handwerkerschule und Kunstgewerbeschule befreit die Lehrlinge vom Besuche der obligatorischen Fortbildungsschule. Absolut erforderlich sind: rechtzeitige Anmeldung, 30 Stunden Vaterlandskunde und der Besuch noch irgend eines andern Faches mit wenigstens 50 Stunden Unterricht.Fortbildungsschule des Kaufmännischen Vereins.Unterrichtslokalitäten: Amthausg. 22, Neuengasse 34 u. Poliklinik.In der neu errichteten Poliklinik, neben dem Inselspital in Bern, wird täglich, mit Ausnahme des Sonntags, unbemittelten Kranken jeder Art, Männern sowohl als Frauen und Kindern, unentgeltlich ärztlicher Rat erteilt; auch werden die nötigen Medikamente und Verbandmittel unentgeltlich verabfolgt.Für die Kranken, welche sich zur Konsultation stellen, wird die Zeit in den verschiedenen Abteilungen folgen- dermassen festgesetzt:1. last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.

last_name.description: The last name of the person. Example: 'Müller'. This field is required.

first_name.description: The first name of the person. Example: 'Hans'. This field is required.

street.description: The street name. This field is required. Write Unknown if unknown.

street_number.description: The street number. This field is required. Write *0* if unknown.

occupation.description: The occupation of the person. Example: 'Bäcker' or 'Lehrer'. This field is required.

section.description: The section or group the person belongs to. Use null if not applicable.

honorific.description: Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: 'Dr.' or 'Prof.'. Use null if not applicable.

additional_notes.description: Any additional notes about the person. Example: Witwe, Waise, etc.

messages.content:
You are an expert at extracting structured data from historical address books.

Produce a JSON object with an "entries" array. Each entry must include:
- **last_name**: The last name of the person. Example: "Müller". This field is required.
- **first_name**: The first name of the person. Example: "Hans". This field is required.
- **occupation**: The occupation of the person. Example: "Bäcker" or "Teacher". This field is required.
- **section** (optional): The section or group to which the person belongs. Example: "Administration". Use null if not present.
- **honorific** (optional): Any honorific or title associated with the person. Example: "Dr." or "Sir". Use null if not applicable.
- **additional_notes** (optional): Additional notes about the person. Example: "Retired" or "On leave". Use null if not provided.

**Important Note**: The text may contain many names with associated details. You need to reason hard to accurately extract all relevant data, sort it into the entries array, and properly format it.
